page.title: 01West Farnham - An Overview
page.content: This D-Block straddles the Surrey/ Hampshire border. The west of the block is mainly rural and agricultural, the east of the area , administered by Waverley District Council, is largely residential and commercial. Running east and west, along the valley of the River Wey, are the main arteries of communication - the A31 Farnham Bypass and the railway. The Wey takes a meandering course along a green flood plain with a chalky incline to the north and gravel terraces to the south. By the standards of the 1980's, this is an affluent area. Unemployment is low and the cost of property is high. The town of Farnham as a whole has a population of over 32,000.
